environmental_concerns.description: Rising global temperatures, extreme weather events, sea-level rise, and ecosystem disruptions.
Large-scale clearing of forests for agriculture, logging, and urbanization, leading to habitat loss and reduced carbon sequestration.
Ongoing extinction of species at an unprecedented rate, threatening the stability and resilience of ecosystems.
Air, water, and soil pollution from industrial, agricultural, and urban activities, impacting human health and ecosystem integrity.
Overexploitation of natural resources such as water, minerals, and fossil fuels, leading to scarcity and environmental degradation.
Widespread use and improper disposal of plastic, leading to pollution of oceans, rivers, and terrestrial ecosystems.
Urbanization and land-use changes resulting in the destruction and fragmentation of natural habitats.
Increase in acidity of the world's oceans due to the absorption of excess carbon dioxide, harming marine life, especially organisms with calcium carbonate shells.
Unsustainable fishing practices depleting fish stocks and disrupting marine ecosystems.
Disproportionate exposure of vulnerable communities to environmental hazards, often linked to issues of social and economic inequality.
